functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: What is the Gini index of the countries that have the world's 4 tallest buildings?
What is the Gini index of the countries that have the world's 4 tallest buildings?

function.name: search
function.arguments: {"query":"List of tallest buildings in the world"}

<fragment>

As of 13 June 2024, this list includes all 93 buildings (completed and architecturally topped out) that reach a height of 340 metres (1,120 ft) or more, as assessed by their highest architectural feature. The building is considered as architecturally topped out when it is under construction, structurally topped out, fully clad, and the highest finished architectural elements are in place.[10]


Of these buildings, almost half are in China. Six of the last seven buildings to have held the record as 'tallest building' are still found in the list, with the exception being the North Tower of the original World Trade Center at 417 metres (1,368 ft) after its destruction in the September 11 attacks of 2001. If the Twin Towers were never destroyed, and One World Trade Center was never built, the WTC towers would rank 35 and 36 on the list today.





|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| **bold** | Denotes building that is or was once the tallest in the world
 |




</fragment>

10. ^ ***a*** ***b*** ***c*** ***d*** *CTBUH Height Criteria for Measuring & Defining Tall Buildings* (PDF). CTBUH.
11. **^** Binder, Georges (August 2006). *101 of the world's tallest buildings*. Images Pub. p. 102. ISBN 978-1864701739.
12. **^** "Tall Buildings In Numbers Vanity Height". Ctbuh.org. Archived from the original on 17 November 2013. Retrieved 21 September 2013.

14. **^** "Create Lists/Graphics – The Skyscraper Center". *www.skyscrapercenter.com*. Retrieved 10 June 2019.

</fragment>

</fragment>
<fragment>

As of 13 June 2024, this list includes all 93 buildings (completed and architecturally topped out) that reach a height of 340 metres (1,120 ft) or more, as assessed by their highest architectural feature. The building is considered as architecturally topped out when it is under construction, structurally topped out, fully clad, and the highest finished architectural elements are in place.[10]


Of these buildings, almost half are in China. Six of the last seven buildings to have held the record as 'tallest building' are still found in the list, with the exception being the North Tower of the original World Trade Center at 417 metres (1,368 ft) after its destruction in the September 11 attacks of 2001. If the Twin Towers were never destroyed, and One World Trade Center was never built, the WTC towers would rank 35 and 36 on the list today.





|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| **bold** | Denotes building that is or was once the tallest in the world
